str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular

str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
Of Hebrew origin; Samaria, a city and region of Palestine.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Sychar, a city of Samaria. Of Hebrew origin; Sychar, a place in Palestine.
Near, nearby, a neighbor. Neuter of a derivative of pelas; close by; as noun, a neighbor, i.e. Fellow.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A place, piece of land, field, property, estate. Diminutive of chora; a spot or plot of ground.
Of Hebrew origin; Jacob, the progenitor of the Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
Joseph, a proper name. Of Hebrew origin; Joseph, the name of seven Israelites.
